Original question: A very hot star is detected in the galaxy M31 located at a distance of d=800 kpc. The star has a temperature T = 6 * 10^5 K and a produces a flux of f =10^(-12) ergs / cm^2 / sec at the Earth. Treat the star’s surface as a blackbody radiator. Compute the star's radius in units of the Sun's radius.
